step1.sentence: When the team leader fell ill, Rosa stepped up and managed the project herself.

step2.story: The charity event needed someone to handle logistics at the last minute. Three volunteers stepped up immediately without being asked, and the event ran smoothly.

step3.story: For the first two seasons on the team, Daniel was a reliable but not exceptional player. When a key teammate got injured before the regional finals, the coach pulled Daniel aside and told him it was his moment. Daniel stepped up in a way no one had seen before. He did not win the game alone, but his energy lifted everyone around him.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 필요한 상황에서 자진해서 나서다; 수준이나 노력을 높이다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 책임을 자처하거나 기대 이상으로 행동할 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: step(발걸음을 내딛다)과 up(위로, 앞으로)이 결합하여 앞으로 나서거나 한 단계 올라간다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 어려운 상황에서 자발적으로 나서는 행동을 칭찬하거나 격려할 때 자주 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: When nobody else volunteered, she stepped up and took charge.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 아무도 자원하지 않았을 때, 그녀가 나서서 책임을 맡았어요.
